title: What is the importance of studying physiological phenomena like those studied by M. Donato and how do skeptics hinder progress?
first_phrase: In this last part of the text, the author warns about the dangers of inducing certain nervous states in people. He attributes this to the work of M. Donato, who has been studying these phenomena for years. The author also mentions how illusions and deception by magicians have caused skepticism about these ideas, but he urges readers to look closely and make sure not to hinder progress in this potentially valuable field. The text mentions M. Donato, mesmerism, and the idea of inducing nervous states that can affect people's memories and actions.
content: Rien n’est plus digne d’éloges que ne le sont les études consciencieuses auxquelles M. Donato se livre depuis plusieurs années; rien n’est plus digne do l’attention du monde savant que ces phénomènes physiologiques. Malheureusement, les prestidigitateurs ont si bien brouillé les cartes depuis Mesmer, ils ont obtenu, à l'aide de signes do convention, et sur des compères salariés, des résultats si extraordinaires en apparence (en apparence seulement), que beaucoup de spectateurs doutent aujourd’hui; ils doutent, mais rien n'est plus facile pour eux que de se convaincre. Le doute est prudent, il est philosophique, mais à la condition d’avoir regardé de près les choses; autrement il cesse d'être prudent et il risque d’entraver, dès scs premiers pas, un art qui peut-être rendra des services inappréciables dans l'avenir.
last_phrase: In conclusion, it is unfortunate that the world of science has been clouded with skepticism as a result of fraudulent performers. However, taking a closer look at things can dispel doubts and pave the way for groundbreaking advancements that could prove invaluable in the future. Let us not repeat the mistakes of the past and take the time to carefully study phenomena, just as M. Donato has done with his studies.
